| Image                   = Superhuman Restraint Unit (Earth-616) from Captain America Vol 5 23 001.png 
| ImageSize               = 250px
| Name                    = Superhuman Restraint Unit
| Aliases                 = Cape-Killers

| Status                  = Defunct

| Identity                = Public
| Reality                 = Earth-616
| BaseOfOperations        = [[S.H.I.E.L.D. Helicarrier]]

| Leaders                 = 
| CurrentMembers          = 
| FormerMembers           = [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)/Members#Cleery (Earth-616)|Cleery]], [[Timothy Dugan (Earth-616)|Dum Dum Dugan]], [[Gabriel Jones (Earth-616)|Gabe Jones]], [[Thomas Aramaki (Earth-616)|Major Tom Aramaki]]
| Allies                  = [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]], Pro-Registration Forces
| Enemies                 = Anti-Registration Forces, [[New Warriors (Earth-616)|New Warriors]], [[Elijah Cross (Earth-616)|Elijah Cross]] ([[X-Cell (Earth-616)|X-Cell]])

| Origin                  = A special unit created to hunt down superheroes who didn't register.
| PlaceOfFormation        = 
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 
| Creators                = Steve McNiven; Mark Millar
| First                   = Civil War Vol 1 1
| Last                    = Iron Manual Mark 3 Vol 1 1

| HistoryText             = After the Superhuman Registration Act was passed, [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] created a special division colloquially referred to as "Cape-Killers" to take down and arrest unregistered superheroes they could find.{{r|Civil War #1}}

During the events of the subsequent Superhuman [[Civil War (Event)|Civil War]], the Cape-Killers were responsible for capturing and transporting unregistered superheroes to the  [[Negative Zone]] prison, [[Prison 42|42]].{{r|Civil War #2|5}}

After [[Norman Osborn (Earth-616)|Norman Osborn]] established [[H.A.M.M.E.R. (Earth-616)|H.A.M.M.E.R.]], he dissolved the Cape-Killers.{{r|Dark Avengers #1}}

| Equipment               = Cape-Killer armor
| Transportation          = Helicarrier, [[Assault Carrier Samuel Sawyer]] and other S.H.I.E.L.D. vehicles including a heavy-duty assault variation on the [[Sky-Cycle]].
| Weapons                 = Tranquilizer guns and pistols as well as other weapons

| Notes                   = 
| Trivia                  = * Their name "Cape-Killers" was given by the media and the public.{{r|Iron Manual Mark 3 Vol 1 1}} It was also used by those in more official roles though.{{r|Captain America Vol 5 22}} 
| Links                   = 
}}
